alert.note: Alert for Jones; Lyman; Stanley (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 21 at 9:56AM MST until February 23 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST /11 AM MST/ WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON CST /11 AM MST/ WEDNESDAY TO NOON CST /11 AM MST/ THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 9 to 13 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations up to 1 inch and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Stanley, Jones and Lyman Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from noon CST /11 AM MST/ Wednesday to noon CST /11 AM MST/ Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from noon CST /11 AM MST/ today to noon CST /11 AM MST/ Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
